nodes.label: Socrates
nodes.summary: Classical Greek philosopher credited as one of the founders of Western philosophy.

nodes.label: Plato
nodes.summary: Student of Socrates and teacher of Aristotle; founded the Academy in Athens.

nodes.label: Aristotle
nodes.summary: Student of Plato; wrote extensively on logic, metaphysics, and ethics.

nodes.label: Nietzsche
nodes.summary: 19th-century philosopher known for critiques of religion and morality.

nodes.label: Immanuel Kant
nodes.summary: Central figure in modern philosophy; formulated the categorical imperative.
